ms3 Quick Reference¶

This page is a quick guide for using ms3 for different tasks. It supposes you are working in an interactive Python interpreter such as IPython, Jupyter, Google Colab, or just the console.

Parsing a single score¶

Locate the MuseScore 3 score you want to parse and make sure it is uncompressed, i.e. it has the extension .mscx and not .mscz.

Tip

MSCZ files are ZIP files containing the uncompressed MSCX. A later version of ms3 will be able to deal with MSCZ, too.
